thread.title: Milo Yiannopoulos Attempts To Defend 'Child Abuse' Comments After Stinging Attack By CNN's Jake Tapper
thread.title_full: Milo Yiannopoulos Attempts To Defend 'Child Abuse' Comments After Stinging Attack By CNN's Jake Tapper

author: Steven Hopkins
title: Milo Yiannopoulos Attempts To Defend 'Child Abuse' Comments After Stinging Attack By CNN's Jake Tapper
text:
Milo Yiannopoulos Attempts To Defend 'Child Abuse' Comments After Stinging Attack By CNN's Jake Tapper Milo explains his comments 'for idiots'. 20/02/2017 13:32 | Updated 25 minutes ago Steven Hopkins Assistant News Editor 
Milo Yiannopoulos has attempted to defend himself after videos emerged ahead of his scheduled speaking engagement at the Conservative Political Action Conference showing him discussing sexual relationships between young boys and adults. 
In an episode of â€˜The Drunken Peasantsâ€™ podcast from 2016 the Brietbart editor recalled his own sexual abuse as a teenager at the hands of a priest and school teacher, but refused to name or condemn the mensâ€™ behaviour, instead saying the encounters had made him good at oral sex. 
In another video, Yiannopoulos decried the â€œarbitrary and oppressive idea of consentâ€ and said some people are â€œcapable of giving consent at a younger ageâ€, adding that relationships between â€œyounger boysâ€ and older men â€œhelp younger men discover who they are and give them a sense of security and safetyâ€. Barcroft Media via Getty Images Milo Yiannopoulos has attempted to defend comment he made seemingly condoning relationships between older men and young boys 
The comments, which emerged just two days after he accused transgender women of wanting to molest children during a â€œReal Time With Bill Maherâ€ appearance, were seized upon with disgust by CNN anchor Jake Tapper. 
Tapper, writing on Twitter, said he felt compelled to speak out after being contacted by a friend who â€œcould not be more distraughtâ€ about Yiannopoulosâ€™ remarks, having himself, been molested as a child. Here is the uncut 5 minute video of Milo Yiannopoulos advocating for Pederasty involving "13 Year old" and "older men." HIS WORDS. @Mschlapp pic.twitter.com/mAgmfpuyvu â€” The Reagan Battalion (@ReaganBattalion) February 20, 2017 ğŸš¨ Breaking: We obtained the #CPAC2017 Milo Yiannopoulos introductory video. This is a must watch! â€” The Reagan Battalion (@ReaganBattalion) February 19, 2017 
Tapper said his friend had told him: â€œMilo straight up defended abusing 13-yr-old boys... Please donâ€™t let that be normalized.â€ 
In a further post he wrote: â€œMore from survivor of sex trafficking: â€˜Please please please donâ€™t let that mess he said go away.â€™ How on earth can CPAC defend this?â€ 
In the videos, which were first published in January but have reappeared ahead of Yiannopoulosâ€™ CPAC speech in Washington this week, the far-right provocateur said people get â€œhung up on this abuse stuffâ€ and that young boys â€œdiscover who they areâ€ through such relationships. 
In another video the journalist said if it hadnâ€™t been for â€œFather Michael, I would have given far less good headâ€, and said despite his younger years he did not consider the incident, abusive, because â€œhe didnâ€™t make me, I was quite enthusiasticâ€. Yiannopoulos then added that he had also had a sexual relationship with his English teacher. Friend of mine, conservative, could not be more distraught by this Milo tape. Was molested as a child. Horrified. â€” Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 20, 2017 My friend, a survivor of sex trafficking: "Milo straight up defended abusing 13 yr old boys...Please don't let that be normalized" â€” Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 20, 2017 More from survivor of sex trafficking: "Please please please don't let that mess he said go away."How on earth can CPAC defend this? â€” Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 20, 2017 Was planning on ignoring for the most part, for those saying "stop publicizing him." But friend reached out & pled w me to say something â€” Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 20, 2017 And sometimes that's what journalists do - give voice to the voiceless. In this case, a survivor of sex trafficking HORRIFIED by Milo. â€” Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 20, 2017 Preying on children is the definition of evil. Justifying it in any way is sick and disturbing. Has everyone lost their minds? â€” Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 20, 2017 
â€œHe was (the priest) fantastic. I was a very mature 14-year-old. It wasnâ€™t molestation, it was perfectly consensual. I was the predator. I was the instigator. I was aggressively seeking out the sexual company of adults because I knew it would horrify people, because I wanted power over them. It was my way of rebelling.â€ 
Yiannopoulosâ€™ comments are not new, having been readily available on YouTube since the podcast shared the nearly three-hour-long interview on January 4. 
The clips, which come after UC Berkeley canceled a speech by Yiannopoulos a few weeks ago amid riots, were brought to light again by a conservative blog known as the Reagan Battalion in an apparent attempt to oppose Yiannopoulosâ€™ appearance at CPAC, which begins Wednesday, the New York Post suggested. Andrew Harnik/AP CNN journalist Jake Tapper, pictured above interviewing Republican presidential candidate Senator Lindsey Graham, took exception to Yiannopoulos' comments 
In a Facebook post, Yiannopoulos has since tried to explain his comments, â€œfor idiotsâ€: â€œI do not support pedophilia. Period. It is a vile and disgusting crime, perhaps the very worst,â€ he wrote. 
Yiannopoulos claimed to have personally outed paedophiles, and said he is â€œdisgusted by the abuse of childrenâ€. However, he did not explicitly deny defending relationships between adults and 13-year-olds, as mentioned in the video. 
But he attempted to clarify his position on such relationships: â€œI did say that there are relationships between younger men and older men that can help a young gay man escape from a lack of support or understanding at home. Thatâ€™s perfectly true and every gay man knows it. But I was not talking about anything illegal and I was not referring to pre-pubescent boys.â€ 
He added: â€œI shouldnâ€™t have used the word â€˜boyâ€™ when I talked about those relationships between older men and younger gay men. (I was talking about my own relationship when I was 17 with a man who was 29. The age of consent in the UK is 16.) That was a mistake. Gay men often use the word â€˜boyâ€™ when they refer to consenting adults. I understand that heterosexual people might not know that, so it was a sloppy choice of words that I regret.â€ â€” ACU (@ACUConservative) February 18, 2017 
Yiannopoulos also claimed the videos were taken out of context, but acknowledged: â€œI *did* joke about giving better head as a result of clerical sexual abuse committed against me when I was a teen.â€ 
He added: â€œIf I choose to deal in an edgy way on an internet livestream with a crime I was the victim of thatâ€™s my prerogative. Itâ€™s no different to gallows humor from AIDS sufferers.â€ 
Yiannopoulos will be given a prominent speaking slot at the influential confab, and is set to upstage stodgier conservative speakers like Vice President Mike Pence and Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker, The Hollywood Reporter noted. White House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus and top President Donald Trump adviser Steve Bannon, a former Breitbart executive, are also speaking . More:
